page.title: 18Catbrook Primary School
page.content: Primary education is provided in the village at Catbrook Primary School. Built in l876, it has two classrooms and a third room which is used as an office, library, TV room and storage. There are 37 children (22 junior and l5 infant) and they are taught by a headteacher and an infant teacher. School meals are brought in daily and served by the two kitchen assistants who supervise the children at lunchtime. Children are also visited by two peripatetic music teachers for wind and stringed instruments. They take part in festivals and concerts. This year the children have produced an anthology of poetry and have been presented with certificates from Cadbury's and W.H. Smith in their national competitions. The PTA is very active and hold fund-raising events every term to provide extra equipment.
